description: a zoomable serpentine timeline. The serpentine shape can be an option for instances where an oblong canvas is not ideal. This visual incorporates a timer to facilitate zoom and fade animations, offering a technique beneficial for drill-down behavior and exploration. This example reveals a few text marks and icons upon zoom, corresponding to the user-selected node. Alternatively, you can render various mark types, axes, legends, etc., to provide additional insights into the selected node. The behavior and shape can be customized using many of the signals below.

title.text: 'Big Five' Mass Extinctions in Earth's History
title.subtitle: Millions of years ago (mya)

signals.name: duration
signals.description: The duration for the zoom transitions. Fade-in transitions will be the same duration, but will be delayed per the amount set here.

signals.name: sRange
signals.description: serpentine: range for the serpentine scale

signals.name: sH
signals.description: serpentine: diameter of arcs

signals.name: sT
signals.description: serpentine: thicknes of the line

signals.name: sN
signals.description: serpentine: number of arcs

signals.name: tickCount
signals.description: ticks: number of axis ticks to display on the timeline

signals.name: mR
signals.description: milestone: the radius for the circular milestone markers

signals.name: domain
signals.description: serpentine: manually set the domain extent for the timeline, otherwise set to null to have the domain calculated for you

signals.name: annotations
signals.description: serpentine: annotations that appear at the start and end of the timeline

signals.name: sD
signals.description: serpentine: dash array for the serpentine line

signals.name: reverse
signals.description: serpentine: boolean to indicate whether the scale for the timeline should be reversed

signals.name: sPct
signals.description: serpentine: percentage of width for the straight portions of the timeline

signals.name: sW
signals.description: serpentine: horizontal length of straight segments

signals.name: sL
signals.description: serpentine: total length of line

signals.name: sA
signals.description: serpentine: length of an arc segment

signals.name: sWsA
signals.description: serpentine: length of a line + arc segment

signals.name: sDomain
signals.description: serpentine: domain for the serpentine scale

signals.name: height
signals.description: calculated height

on.update: !isValid(hoverFocus) || showDetails ? '' : {title: hoverFocus['domain'] + 'M years ago', 'Event:': hoverFocus['name'], 'Lost:': format(datum['Percentage of species lost'], '.0%') + ' species lost'}

signals.name: k
signals.description: The scale used for zooming based on the focused node

signals.name: k0
signals.description: The previous scale used for zooming based on the focused node

signals.name: root
signals.description: The initial node (in this case, background rect) which all zoom calculations are based off
signals.update: {timestamp: now(), id: 0, x: width/2-(sPct===1 ? -15 : 40), 'y': height/2, k: 1}

signals.name: focus
signals.description: The user-selected node

on.update: t!== 1 || (isValid(datum) && !isValid(datum['domain'])) ? focus : !isValid(datum) || focus['id'] === datum['id'] ? {timestamp: now(), id: root['id'], x: root['x'], 'y': root['y'], k: root['k']} : {timestamp: now(), id: datum['id'], x: datum['x'], y: datum['y'], k: k>1? k : k}

signals.name: focus0
signals.description: The previous user-selected node

signals.name: timer
signals.description: The timer to be used for transitions such as zoom, fade, etc.

signals.name: interpolateTime
signals.description: the start and end times in miliseconds for animation interpolations

signals.name: t
signals.description: The normalized time for easing

signals.name: tEase
signals.description: The easing calculation. Currently set as easeInOutCubic

signals.name: interpolateTimeDelayed
signals.description: The delayed time for easing

signals.name: tDelayed
signals.description: The delayed normalized time for easing

signals.name: tEaseDelayed
signals.description: The delayed easing calculation. Currently set as easeInOutCubic
signals.update: tDelayed < 0.5 ? 4 * tDelayed * tDelayed * tDelayed : (tDelayed - 1) * (2 * tDelayed - 2) * (2 * tDelayed - 2) + 1

signals.name: showDetails
signals.description: A boolean to indicate whether to show a node's details

signals.name: _width
signals.description: calculated width after marks have been drawn

signals.name: _height
signals.description: calculated width after marks have been drawn

text.signal: ['Interactivity instructions:', '• Click on a node to zoom-in.', '• To slow down animations: ⌘ + click (Mac) / ⊞ + click (Windows).']

x.signal: lerp([root['x'] + ((-sH*0.75) - focus0['x']) * k0, root['x'] + ((-sH*0.75) - focus['x']) * k], tEase)

y.signal: lerp([root['y'] + (-70 - focus0['y']) * k0, root['y'] + (-70 - focus['y']) * k], tEase)

marks.name: annotations
marks.description: Text marks that appear at the start and end of the timeline. Configured using the 'annotations' signal

x.signal: lerp([root['x'] + (datum['x'] - focus0['x']) * k0, root['x'] + (datum['x'] - focus['x']) * k], tEase)

y.signal: lerp([root['y'] + (datum['y'] - focus0['y']) * k0, root['y'] + (datum['y'] - focus['y']) * k], tEase)

marks.name: axis_group
marks.description: group containing all the axis marks - domain, arrow indicators, tick lines, tick labels on straightaways, tick labels on arcs

marks.name: serpentine_line
marks.description: The serpentine-shaped line that acts as the domain used for the timeline

x.signal: lerp([root['x'] + (datum['x'] - focus0['x']) * k0, root['x'] + (datum['x'] - focus['x']) * k], tEase)

y.signal: lerp([root['y'] + (datum['y'] - focus0['y']) * k0, root['y'] + (datum['y'] - focus['y']) * k], tEase)

marks.name: arrow_marks
marks.description: The arrows to indicate direction that appear at the beginning and end of each arc+straightaway combonation

x.signal: lerp([root['x'] + (datum['x'] - focus0['x']) * k0, root['x'] + (datum['x'] - focus['x']) * k], tEase)

y.signal: lerp([root['y'] + (datum['y'] - focus0['y']) * k0, root['y'] + (datum['y'] - focus['y']) * k], tEase)

marks.name: tick_marks
marks.description: The line (text mark) designated to each tick

x.signal: lerp([root['x'] + (datum['x'] - focus0['x']) * k0, root['x'] + (datum['x'] - focus['x']) * k], tEase)

y.signal: lerp([root['y'] + (datum['y'] - focus0['y']) * k0, root['y'] + (datum['y'] - focus['y']) * k], tEase)

x.signal: lerp([root['x'] + (datum['x'] - focus0['x']) * k0, root['x'] + (datum['x'] - focus['x']) * k], tEase)

y.signal: lerp([root['y'] + (datum['y'] - focus0['y']) * k0, root['y'] + (datum['y'] - focus['y']) * k], tEase)

x.signal: lerp([root['x'] + (datum['x'] - focus0['x']) * k0, root['x'] + (datum['x'] - focus['x']) * k], tEase)

y.signal: lerp([root['y'] + (datum['y'] - focus0['y']) * k0, root['y'] + (datum['y'] - focus['y']) * k], tEase)

marks.name: milestone_group
marks.description: group containing the milestone backgrounds and arcs

marks.name: milestone_background_marks
marks.description: Arcs that serve as the milestone background

x.signal: lerp([root['x'] + (datum['x'] - focus0['x']) * k0, root['x'] + (datum['x'] - focus['x']) * k], tEase)

y.signal: lerp([root['y'] + (datum['y'] - focus0['y']) * k0, root['y'] + (datum['y'] - focus['y']) * k], tEase)

marks.name: milestone_arc_marks
marks.description: Arcs that serve as an encoded percentage for a given measure

x.signal: lerp([root['x'] + (datum['x'] - focus0['x']) * k0, root['x'] + (datum['x'] - focus['x']) * k], tEase)

y.signal: lerp([root['y'] + (datum['y'] - focus0['y']) * k0, root['y'] + (datum['y'] - focus['y']) * k], tEase)

innerRadius.signal: showDetails ? lerp([mR*k0, mR*1.1*k], tEase) : lerp([mR*1.1*k0, mR*k], tEase)

marks.name: footer_group
marks.description: The group of marks located at the bottom of the canvas that provide additional information about the visual

marks.name: footer_prefix_text
marks.description: The labels for each footer item

marks.name: footer_href_text
marks.description: The hyperlinks for each footer item

marks.name: details_title
marks.details: the name of the node (appears on zoom)

marks.name: details_title_subtitle
marks.details: the subtitle of the node (appears on zoom)

marks.name: details_percentage
marks.details: the measure as text formatted as a percentage (appears on zoom)

marks.name: details_percentage_suffix
marks.details: the text that appears after the measure percentage text (appears on zoom)

marks.name: details_desecription
marks.details: Wrapped text that further describes the user-selected node (appears on zoom)

marks.name: details_icon_path
marks.details: An icon associated with the user-selected node (appears on zoom)

values.name: End Ordovician
values.Cause of extinction: Intense glacial and interglacial periods created large sea-level swings and moved shorelines dramatically. The tectonic uplift of the Appalachian mountains created lots of weathering, sequestration of CO2, and with it, changes in climate and ocean chemistry.

values.name: Late Devonian
values.Cause of extinction: Rapid growth and diversification of land plants generated rapid and severe global cooling.

values.name: End Permian
values.Cause of extinction: Intense volcanic activity in Siberia. This caused global warming. Elevated CO2 and sulfur (H2S) levels from volcanoes caused ocean acidification, acid rain, and other changes in ocean and land chemistry.

values.name: End Triassic
values.Cause of extinction: Underwater volcanic activity in the Central Atlantic Magmatic Province (CAMP) caused global warming and a dramatic change in the chemical composition of the oceans.

values.name: End Cretaceous
values.Cause of extinction: Asteroid impact in Yucatán, Mexico. This caused a global cataclysm and rapid cooling. Some changes may have already pre-dated this asteroid, with intense volcanic activity and tectonic uplift.

transform.expr: datum['id'] === 1 ? sDomain[0] : datum['id'] === tickCount ? sDomain[1] : null

datum['category'] === 'start' ? [sDomain[reverse ? 1 : 0]] : datum['category'] === 'serpentine' ? pluck(data('serpentineDomain'), 'domain') : datum['category'] === 'milestone' ? pluck(data('dataset'), 'domain') : datum['category']==='tick' ? pluck(data('tickDomain'), 'domain') : datum['category'] === 'end' ? [sDomain[reverse ? 0 : 1]] : null
